summary:
Sam: so how have you been?
Steve: fine. Except for this headache. Comes and goes.
Tony: *enters room*
Steve: oh, look, there it...
body:
Sam: so how have you been?

Steve: fine. Except for this headache. Comes and goes.

Tony: *enters room*

Steve: oh, look, there it is.

blog.name: cyberdelph
blog.title: Delph's World
blog.description:
I love reading...I like quotes and girly stuff...

Fan of the Cut & Run Serie & MM romance. 

Also a Black Dagger Brotherhood addict and a THIRDs nerds.

My favorite TV shows are : The Vampire Diaries, Teen Wolf, Buffy the vampire Slayer, Beauty & the Beast, Nikita, Bitten, Sherlock, Almost Human,Veronica Mars, The Following, Flash,iZombie,Supernatural, Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D, MCU...

Sometimes NSFW, so be warned...

Multifandom blog - Hate free blog. 
Multi shipper - Ship all the ships...No drama zone.

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

title:
Show
          Chapter
        |
        Archive of Our Own
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
an endgame strategy where the king doesn’t die

chapters: 1/?

words: 279

summary: 

Tony Stark wakes up in a softly lit room; nothing like he’d pictured the end to be. More of bright white and the end of a tunnel, finding an old friend and playing chess for eternity. Losing every game except one.

His only win played on a broken battlefield surrounded by his queen and his knights and rooks and bishops and pawns scattered around the board.

The enemy thinks he’s won but the king sacrifices himself for his kingdom.

That’s his winning strategy.

That’s the endgame.

reblog.comment:
an endgame strategy where the king doesn’t die

title: Ironstrange Bingo Entry 13: (Free for All)
body:
Title: The Prince and the Clocksmith   

Notes: Aaayyy here’s the clockpunk AU that’s been ruining my brain!

Two songs i kept playing over and over while writing this:  Armaan Malik’s “Kyun Rabba” (when Stephen lost the use of his hands) and Sam Tinnesz’ “Hold On For Your Life” (when Tony is pursuing Stephen).

Yes, I totally had Ancheim from the Bravely Default series in mind for the clockwork kingdom.

Also, completely unrelated: please read Harlan Ellison’s “Repent, Harlequin! said the Ticktockman” before a movie about it comes out [full text (PDF)]. It was one of the stories that influenced me growing up, and maybe it influenced this fic a little bit, too. Just a little xD

For lack of alternatives, I’m using the “Free for All” square on my @ironstrangebingo card (/sobs discreetly because I’d wanted to save that square for last T_T)

***

A long time ago, in the middle of a vast and isolated desert, there was a land made almost entirely of clockwork.

It may sound funny, but it’s true.

Grain mills, water wheels, and vehicles used to transport wares and people, were run with clockwork machinery. Some citizens even lived with parts of their bodies made of clockwork.

That wasn’t all - there were soldiers, laborers, entertainers, teachers, and doctors that were made of clockwork.

They looked like humans, sometimes behaved like humans - but they were not human. Their skin was metal, their guts steel receptacles and wire, and their blood the dark lifeblood of the desert, which the citizens of the kingdom called “oil.”

The secret of making these human-like clockwork creatures was so intricate and so intimately kept, that it could not be replicated - only the people of this kingdom knew about it, and could make it with their own two hands.

The land was prosperous, because its people took the concept of time to heart. Its people acted precisely, down to the last second, not missing a beat, moving as parts of a great machine - and they took joy in it, thinking it a noble purpose.

This land was ruled by a king and his son.

The King was ruthless and cold. He used his clockwork armies to conquer other nearby kingdoms. He exiled or executed anyone who rebelled against the very strict timelines he imposed.

His people agreed: it was his brutality that made him great.

The Prince was not as cold. But he, too, dreamed of greatness.

But where his father dreamed of being feared, he dreamed of being loved.

He made his own clockwork creations with his own two hands - things that did not seek to kill, or conquer, but instead sought to protect, to preserve, and to create other things in turn.

The Prince looked at them and thought: “With these, I can become a great king. An even greater king than my father is.”

***

Now, the Prince had a friend.

This friend had been his rival, when they were still in school.

Where the Prince was friendly and jovial, the friend was stern and severe.

They both knew much about clockwork, but thought of it differently.

The friend believed that clockwork beings had no heart, and existed only to serve those that did.

The Prince disagreed.

“Hearts can be grown,” the Prince argued. “You can see it in how affection builds even where there was none before.”

“Humans are not made of clockwork,” the friend argued back. “Clockwork is simple. Affection is not.”

In a way, the friend was right. Affections were not simple.

They both saw this in how they were drawn to each other, how they sought each other out, in spite of their disagreements, their many differences.

But in a way, the Prince was also right. Hearts could be grown.

They both saw this in how they were constantly in each other’s thoughts, how they found themselves growing ever closer.

***

[Read the rest @AO3]

title: Anna: The Last Avenger
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2XkDp3P

by Ksmarvelbunch

What happens when your greatest weakness becomes your greatest strength?

title: house rules
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Mz79J0

by delightfulalot

“The point of the game is to get the balls into your opponents’ cups.”

“Oh, I know how it works,” Steve says, all swag and confidence. He bounces a ball off the table and – catches it on the back of his hand.

“Shit,” Tony breathes, and then he looks up to see Steve looking at him. Steve winks.

Words: 2557, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark, Wanda Maximoff, Pietro Maximoff
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Undercover, undercover at a frat house, beer pong, Body Shots


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Mz79J0

summary: lil’ doodles is back! Stickers available here! Once they’re sold out, they’re gone! If you buy Sets 1, 2 and 3, you get a giant...
caption:
lil’ doodles is back!

Stickers available here!

Once they’re sold out, they’re gone!

If you buy Sets 1, 2 and 3, you get a giant Iron Monger sticker for free!

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Myosotis
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://archiveofourown.org/works/19070569

by BladedFeather

Steve is slumped by his right side, Natasha has her toes dug under his thigh on his left, her head is pillowed on Clint’s lap while she plays on her phone.

Bucky feels a rare sense of contentment.

Words: 5280, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

blog.name: skyhawk3x
blog.title: Sylvia the Writer
blog.description: I am a trans girl and a writer. If I have offended you, CALMLY say how, and I will try not to do so in the future. I'm always open to any question (And I mean ANY question) and if you need someone to talk to I guess I'm all right. Aspiring author! Trying to make my mark in the world with my superhero series. Because I learned my lesson about the existence of terfs, if you don't think trans people, or bi/pan people, are valid, don't fucking reblog my shit to make fun of me. I will block you. I am extremely conflict-averse due to abuse, and I can't psychologically handle being made fun of and invalidated all the time. I came here to make friends, not to be told I'm an invalid fetishist. So if you don't like, IGNORE. Thank you, please enjoy your visit. Also, anon hate will be either deleted or have my policy explained to them. My policy: say it to my face, bitch.

summary:
Thanos: *gets rejected by Lady Death* 
Thanos: It’s official. Women have become too entitled. Fat ugly purple men like me don’t...
body:
Thanos: *gets rejected by Lady Death*

Thanos: It’s official. Women have become too entitled. Fat ugly purple men like me don’t stand a chance anymore.

Tony: How many fat ugly purple women have you asked out?

Thanos: Why tf would I do that

reblog.comment:

blog.name: pixelcharming
blog.title: Virtuous Dreaming
blog.description:
Insta: Pxlcharm
/
Twitch: EightBitZoo

body:
Stan the Man

I don’t care if this is stupid, promotes violence, or even if you don’t agree. It’s my opinion and I am targeting no one intentionally. BUT. if you talk shit about Stan Lee near me in any way, I WILL PUNCH YOU IN THE FUCKING THROAT. That man is the father of comic books and is literally a precious treasure. He will be forever missed and yeah I will punch you in the face. Love you Stan, rest in peace. Stay woke Y'all
